intro: Mutisia philippii, commonly known as the Andean mutisia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy composite flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude areas, often in rocky or alpine environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range from white to yellow in color. Mutisia philippii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
